SENT.plain: It is well known that BehÃ§et's disease (BD) is strongly associated with human leukocyte antigen (HLA) B51 in many ethnic groups
However, there has been no published report as yet with respect to this association among the Iranian people

Furthermore, since it is now known that the B51 antigen can be encoded by 21 alleles, B*5101-B*5121, we performed HLA-B*51 allele typing as well as HLA class I genotyping of 48 Iranian patients with this disease
As a result, the frequency of the B*51 allele was significantly higher (62.1%) in the patient group as compared with the ethnically matched control group (31.8%) (Pc=0.067, R.R.=3.51)
In the genotyping of B*51 alleles, 33 out of the 36 B*51-positive patients possessed B*5101 and the remaining 3 carried B*5108
This study revealed that Iranian patients with BD also had a strong association with HLA-B51
In addition, this significantly high incidence of HLA-B*51 was found to be caused by an increase in both the HLA-B*5101 and HLA-B*5108 alleles
However, there was no significant difference in the HLA-B*51 allelic distribution between the patient and control groups
